pages.text: Thermal Cultivation adds a variety of crops, the seeds of which may be purchased from villagers. These crops can be harvested by right clicking with an empty hand. Mushroom crops may be planted on $(l:thermal:world/plants/phytogro)phyto-soil$(/l), mycelium, or podzol, but cannot be bonemealed or phyto-gro'ed. They are still affected by phyto-soil and $(l:thermal:equipment/tools/watering_can)watering can$(/l) growth bonuses.

pages.A.title: Barley
pages.A.text: A cereal grain which can be ground into flour or malted to make beer or whiskey.
pages.B.title: Corn
pages.B.text: A staple grain prized for its versatility.

pages.A.title: Flax
pages.A.text: A fibrous plant that can easily be processed into string.
pages.B.title: Onion
pages.B.text: A bulbous vegetable that is often used to add flavor to a savory dish. Brings people to tears.

pages.A.title: Radish
pages.A.text: A root vegetable with a sharp flavor, typically eaten raw or steamed.
pages.B.title: Rice
pages.B.text: The most widely consumed staple grain in the world. Laborious to harvest.

pages.A.title: Sadiroot
pages.A.text: A medicinal spice known for its cleansing properties. Has a distinctive aroma.
pages.B.title: Spinach
pages.B.text: The leaves of a spinach plant. Grants sailors an increase in muscle mass.

pages.A.title: Bell Pepper
pages.A.text: A cultivar of peppers without the spice. Commonly chopped and used in dishes.
pages.B.title: Eggplant
pages.B.text: A purple, spongy $(l)fruit$() used in many dishes. Tends to absorb other flavors.

pages.A.title: Green Bean
pages.A.text: The immature seed pods of a bean plant. Can be consumed alone or cooked in various dishes.
pages.B.title: Peanut
pages.B.text: The seeds of a peanut plant. Often roasted, pressed into oil, or ground into peanut butter.

pages.A.title: Strawberry
pages.A.text: A sweet, red fruit used in a variety of condiments and desserts.
pages.B.title: Tomato
pages.B.text: A savory, red $(l)fruit$() often sliced for dishes or squeezed for sauces and soups.

pages.A.title: Coffee
pages.A.text: The fruit of a coffee tree, the pit of which can be roasted, ground, and brewed to make the lifeblood of mod devs.
pages.B.title: Tea
pages.B.text: The leaves of a tea plant. Often dumped into the ocean during tea parties.

pages.A.title: Hops
pages.A.text: The seed cones of a flowering hop vine. Used to flavor beer.
pages.B.title: Frost Melon
pages.B.text: A blue cultivar of melons. Those who consume it find that even the hottest of surfaces feel icy.

pages.A.title: Fluxtooth
pages.A.text: A pale mushroom that exudes a viscous, redstone-like emulsion when mature.
pages.B.title: Glimmercap
pages.B.text: A glowing fungus that produces a thin layer of shimmering, golden powder on its cap.

pages.A.title: Boomshroom
pages.A.text: A temperamental mushroom that grows webs of explosive material on its underside.
pages.B.title: Slitake
pages.B.text: A gooey fungus that secretes protective slime, which can be congealed into balls.
